cosmology.name: The Great Wheel
cosmology.description: The default D&D cosmology includes more than two dozen planes. The most common understanding visualizes them as concentric wheels, with the material realms at the center. The Inner Planes form a wheel around the Material Plane, enveloped in the Ethereal Plane. The Outer Planes form another wheel around that one, arranged according to alignment, with the Outlands linking them all.

alternateConfigurations.name: World Tree
alternateConfigurations.description: Planes situated among the roots and branches of a great cosmic tree (literally or figuratively)

alternateConfigurations.name: Vertical Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: Material realms suspended between two other realities: the astral realms (the Astral Plane and the Outer Planes) above and the elemental realms (the Inner Planes) below

alternateConfigurations.name: Simplified Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: A cosmology with fewer planes: a Material Plane; the Transitive Planes; a single undifferentiated Elemental Plane; an Overheaven; and an Underworld

alternateConfigurations.name: Orbital Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: Planes arranged in a complex system of orbits, with planes exerting greater influence on the Material Plane the closer they draw to it

planeCategories.name: Material Realms
planeCategories.description: Most D&D worlds are located on the Material Plane, which has two planar echoes: the Feywild and the Shadowfell.

planeCategories.name: Transitive Planes
planeCategories.description: The Ethereal Plane and the Astral Plane are boundless realms that provide passage between other planes of existence.

planeCategories.name: Inner Planes
planeCategories.description: The four Elemental Planes (Air, Earth, Fire, and Water), plus the Para-elemental Planes between them, are the Inner Planes.

planeCategories.name: Outer Planes
planeCategories.description: Seventeen Outer Planes correspond to the nine alignments and shades of philosophical difference between them.

planeCategories.name: Positive and Negative Planes
planeCategories.description: These two planes enfold the rest of the cosmology, providing the raw forces of life and death that underlie all existence in the multiverse.

planes.name: Elemental Plane of Water
planes.philosophicalEssence: The nature of water is to flow, not like the gusting wind or the leaping flame, but smoothly and steadily. It is the rhythm of the tide, the nectar of life, the bitter tears of mourning, and the balm of sympathy and healing. Given time, it can erode all in its path.
planes.emotionalInfluence: The plane embodies the steady, rhythmic flow of water—smooth, patient, and relentless. Its nature is life-giving yet capable of overwhelming destruction.

physicalProperties.shape: An endless sea called the Sea of Worlds, dotted with atolls and islands rising from enormous coral reefs that stretch forever into the depths.
physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: The plane is predominantly water. Air breathers require air pockets, islands, or atolls that rise above the surface. Most natives never break the surface of the sea. Land above the surface is hotly contested by the few air breathers that live on the plane. Fleets of rafts and ships lashed together serve as solid ground where nothing else is available.

temperature.description: A warm sun arcs across the sky. The Sea of Light has sunlit warm waters. The Sea of Ice bordering the Para-elemental Plane of Ice features frigid water choked with icebergs and sheet ice. The Darkened Depths have absolute cold and crushing pressure.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Weather on the plane is a lesson in extremes. If the sea isn't calm, it is battered by storms. Several times a day, the sky clouds over and releases a deluge of rain, often accompanied by spectacular shows of lightning, before clearing up again. On rare occasions, a tremor in the planar firmament sends a rogue wave sweeping across the plane, swamping entire islands and driving ships down to the reefs.

timeFlow.description: Time flows normally on the Elemental Plane of Water. No special time flow rules are specified.

hazards.name: Rogue Waves
hazards.description: On rare occasions, a tremor in the planar firmament sends a rogue wave sweeping across the plane, swamping entire islands and driving ships down to the reefs.

encounterProbability.description: Rare occasions; a tremor in the planar firmament triggers the event

hazards.sourceReference: Chapter 6: Cosmology - Elemental Plane of Water

hazards.name: Extreme Storms
hazards.description: The weather on the plane is a lesson in extremes. If the sea isn't calm, it is battered by storms. Several times a day, the sky clouds over and releases a deluge of rain, often accompanied by spectacular shows of lightning, before clearing up again.

encounterProbability.description: Several times a day the sky clouds over and releases a deluge of rain with lightning

hazards.sourceReference: Chapter 6: Cosmology - Elemental Plane of Water

hazards.name: Darkened Depths
hazards.description: The deeper extents of the plane, where no sunlight reaches, are called the Darkened Depths. Horrid creatures dwell here, and the absolute cold and crushing pressure mean a swift end to creatures accustomed to the surface or the Sea of Light. Krakens and other mighty leviathans claim this realm.

dayNightCycle.description: No sunlight reaches the Darkened Depths.

hazards.sourceReference: Chapter 6: Cosmology - Elemental Plane of Water

hazards.name: Temporary Storm Portals
hazards.description: The storms that move across the sea sometimes create temporary portals to the Material Plane and draw ships into the Plane of Water. Surviving vessels from countless worlds and navies ply these waters with little hope of ever returning home.

encounterProbability.description: Storms sometimes create temporary portals; ships are drawn in from the Material Plane

hazards.sourceReference: Chapter 6: Cosmology - Elemental Plane of Water

hazards.name: Underwater Combat Rules
hazards.description: Most of the plane is underwater. Melee attacks with weapons have Disadvantage unless the weapon deals Piercing damage or the attacker has a Swim Speed. Ranged weapon attacks automatically miss beyond normal range and have Disadvantage within normal range. Anything underwater has Resistance to Fire damage.
hazards.sourceReference: Chapter 1: Playing the Game - Underwater Combat

hazards.name: Suffocation Risk
hazards.description: Air-breathing creatures submerged in the endless sea risk suffocation. A creature can hold its breath for a number of minutes equal to 1 + its Constitution modifier (minimum of 30 seconds). When out of breath, it can survive for a number of rounds equal to its Constitution modifier (minimum 1 round), then drops to 0 HP and is dying until it can breathe again.

environmentalEffects.name: Underwater Fire Resistance
environmentalEffects.description: Anything underwater has Resistance to Fire damage.
environmentalEffects.mechanicalEffect: All creatures and objects underwater on this plane have Resistance to Fire damage. Fire damage is halved (rounded down).
environmentalEffects.sourceReference: Chapter 1: Playing the Game - Underwater Combat

environmentalEffects.name: Impeded Weapons Underwater
environmentalEffects.description: When making a melee attack roll with a weapon underwater, a creature that lacks a Swim Speed has Disadvantage on the attack roll unless the weapon deals Piercing damage. A ranged attack roll with a weapon underwater automatically misses a target beyond the weapon's normal range, and the attack roll has Disadvantage against a target within normal range.
environmentalEffects.mechanicalEffect: Creatures without Swim Speed have Disadvantage on melee weapon attacks unless weapon deals Piercing damage. Ranged weapon attacks auto-miss beyond normal range and have Disadvantage within normal range.
environmentalEffects.sourceReference: Chapter 1: Playing the Game - Underwater Combat

portals.name: Oceanic Maelstrom Vortex

requirement.description: A maelstrom in the depths of the ocean on the Material Plane leads to the Plane of Water. The storms that move across the sea sometimes create temporary portals to the Material Plane.
requirement.situationCondition: Maelstrom in the ocean depths or storms on the Plane of Water

portals.colorOrAppearance: A swirling maelstrom in the depths of the ocean

portals.name: Isle of Dread Storm Portal

requirement.description: A storm regularly sweeps over the Isle of Dread, connecting it to the Material Plane. Ships from different worlds end up wrecked on the island. Travelers who understand the workings of the storm could use it to travel to a desired Material Plane world.
requirement.situationCondition: The regular storm that sweeps over the Isle of Dread

portals.colorOrAppearance: A storm that regularly sweeps over the island

planarConnections.name: Sea of Ice to Para-elemental Plane of Ice
planarConnections.description: Bordering the Para-elemental Plane of Ice is the Sea of Ice. The frigid water is choked with icebergs and sheet ice, which are inhabited by cold-loving creatures from the Plane of Ice. Drifting icebergs can carry these creatures farther into the Plane of Water.

planarConnections.name: Silt Flats to Para-elemental Plane of Ooze
planarConnections.description: The region of the Plane of Water nearest to the Para-elemental Plane of Ooze is called the Silt Flats. The water is thick with soil and sludge, turning into muddy ground before giving way to the great swamp that is the Para-elemental Plane.
hazards: Thick water with soil and sludge

notableEntities.name: Emperor of the Marids
notableEntities.title: Nominal Emperor of the Marids
notableEntities.description: The nominal emperor of the marids dwells in the Citadel of Ten Thousand Pearls. Visitors are welcome to ask favors of the emperor, whose mood is as changeable as the sea.
notableEntities.rulesLocation: Citadel of Ten Thousand Pearls, Sea of Light

civilizations.name: Marid Court
civilizations.description: The marids dwell in the Citadel of Ten Thousand Pearls, an opulent palace made of coral and studded with pearls. The palace is the glittering centerpiece of the Sea of Light.
civilizations.location: Citadel of Ten Thousand Pearls, Sea of Light

civilizations.name: Sea of Light Aquatic Peoples
civilizations.description: Aquatic peoples craft castles and fortresses in the coral reefs of the Sea of Light.

civilizations.name: Isle of Dread Settlements
civilizations.description: Settlements across the Isle of Dread are populated by the descendants of sailors from different worlds of the Material Plane who never found a way home.

civilizations.name: Shipwrecked Fleets
civilizations.description: Surviving vessels from countless worlds and navies ply these waters with little hope of ever returning home. Fleets of rafts and ships lashed together serve as solid ground.
civilizations.location: Various, across the Sea of Worlds

domainsOrRegions.name: Sea of Worlds
domainsOrRegions.description: The endless sea that constitutes the Elemental Plane of Water, dotted with atolls and islands that rise up from enormous coral reefs that seem to stretch forever into the depths.

domainsOrRegions.name: Citadel of Ten Thousand Pearls

ruler.name: Emperor of the Marids
ruler.title: Nominal Emperor of the Marids
ruler.description: The nominal emperor of the marids dwells in the Citadel of Ten Thousand Pearls. Visitors are welcome to ask favors of the emperor, whose mood is as changeable as the sea.

domainsOrRegions.description: An opulent palace made of coral and studded with pearls. The palace is the glittering centerpiece of the Sea of Light.

domainsOrRegions.name: Darkened Depths
domainsOrRegions.description: The deeper extents of the plane, where no sunlight reaches. Horrid creatures dwell here, and the absolute cold and crushing pressure mean a swift end to creatures accustomed to the surface or the Sea of Light. Krakens and other mighty leviathans claim this realm.

domainsOrRegions.name: Isle of Dread
domainsOrRegions.description: One of the few islands on the plane, connected to the Material Plane by means of a storm that regularly sweeps over the island. Ships from different worlds of the Material Plane end up wrecked on the rocks and reefs around the island. Settlements are populated by descendants of sailors who never found a way home. Theoretically, travelers who understand the workings of the storm could use it to travel to a desired Material Plane world.

domainsOrRegions.name: Sea of Ice
domainsOrRegions.description: Bordering the Para-elemental Plane of Ice. The frigid water is choked with icebergs and sheet ice, which are inhabited by cold-loving creatures from the Plane of Ice. Drifting icebergs can carry these creatures farther into the Plane of Water to threaten ships and islands in warmer seas.

domainsOrRegions.name: Sea of Light
domainsOrRegions.description: Life flourishes in the sunlit waters of the Sea of Light, located in the upper reaches of the Sea of Worlds. Aquatic peoples craft castles and fortresses in the coral reefs here. The Citadel of Ten Thousand Pearls is the glittering centerpiece of this region.

domainsOrRegions.name: Silt Flats
domainsOrRegions.description: The region of the Plane of Water nearest to the Para-elemental Plane of Ooze. The water is thick with soil and sludge, turning into muddy ground before giving way to the great swamp that is the Para-elemental Plane.

adventureThemes: The erosive power of water over time
Destruction wrought by surging tides, deadly maelstroms, and raging torrents
The rhythm of the tide as metaphor for life's flow
Water as the nectar of life, the bitter tears of mourning, and the balm of sympathy and healing
Cultists of Evil Water who believe the seas are eager to reclaim the water trapped in living creatures
Survival on a plane dominated by water with scarce dry land
Encounters with shipwrecked civilizations from countless worlds

crossReferences.description: Chapter 3 referenced for Environmental Effects applicable to Inner Planes
Ethereal Curtains table (d12 entry 8): Elemental Plane of Water has Green curtain color
Planar Portals section: a maelstrom in the depths of the ocean is cited as a vortex portal leading to the Plane of Water

planarTravelMethods.name: Planar Portals
planarTravelMethods.description: Portals are stationary interplanar connections. A maelstrom in the depths of the ocean on the Material Plane can serve as a vortex portal to the Plane of Water. Storms on the Plane of Water sometimes create temporary portals to the Material Plane.
requirements: Find a portal leading to the desired destination
Meet the portal's requirements (command, key item, random timing, situation, or time-based)
risks: Portals may not be open at all times

planarTravelMethods.name: Planar Travel Spells
planarTravelMethods.description: Spells such as Gate and Plane Shift can directly transport adventurers to the Elemental Plane of Water. Etherealness allows entry to the Ethereal Plane, from which the Border Ethereal overlapping the Plane of Water can be accessed.
requirements: Ability to cast the appropriate spell
Proper tuning fork for Plane Shift
risks: Plane Shift may lack precision in arrival location

planarTravelMethods.name: Ethereal Curtain to Plane of Water
planarTravelMethods.description: In the Deep Ethereal, green-colored curtains of vapor lead to a region of the Border Ethereal connected to the Elemental Plane of Water.
requirements: Access to the Deep Ethereal via Plane Shift, Gate, or a magical portal
risks: Travel through the Deep Ethereal takes 1d10 × 10 hours

savingThrowProbabilities.formula: P(fail | modifier m) = max(0.05, min(0.95, (DC - 1 - m) / 20))
